2024-06-09_Audio_0945.m4a.explanation: The audio features a vocalist singing individual notes slowly and sustainingly in ascending order (Sa, Re, Ga, Ma, Pa, Dha, Ni, Sa). All notes are *shuddh* (natural), which is characteristic of Raga Bilawal. This structured, note-by-note exposition is a form of *sargam* practice or *swar sadhana*, which can be classified as a basic *alaap* (slow, unmetered exploration of the raga's notes) and also as a fundamental *paltaa* (melodic exercise). There is no rhythmic accompaniment, hence the *taal* is unknown.
